page.title: 14The Market in Braintree.
page.content: Braintree market in 1985 takes place twice a week on Wednesdays and Saturdays. It is mainly a fruit and vegetable market with clothes stalls and household items. It is held in Market Square, extends through High Street and into Bank Street. The modern market is different from the one started nearly 800 years ago, in 1199 with a charter from King John. Then the colourful stalls were packed into Little Square. Through the years the number of stalls multiplied until the market was bursting at the seams and a new market cross was errected in 1631 in New Street. This moved once again to the present site in 1826. The wool trade used this market and Braintree's population grew as a result during this period.
